item.title: PyTorch at the Edge: Deploying Over 964 TIMM Models on Android with TorchScript and Flutter
item.description: üî• Motivation With various high-level libraries like Keras, Transformer, and Fastai, the barrier to training SOTA models has never been lower. On top of that with platforms like Google Colab and Kaggle, pretty much anyone can train a reasonably good model using an old laptop or even a mobile phone (with some patience). The question is no longer “can we train a SOTA model?”, but “what happens after that?” Unfortunately, after getting the model trained, most people wash their hands off at this point claiming their model works.

item.title: fastdup: A Powerful Tool to Manage, Clean & Curate Visual Data at Scale on Your CPU - For Free.
item.description: ‚úÖ Motivation As a data scientist, you might be tempted to jump into modeling as soon as you can. I mean, that’s the fun part, right? But trust me, if you skip straight to modeling without taking the time to really understand the problem and analyze the data, you’re setting yourself up for failure. I’ve been there. You might feel like a superstar, but you’ll have with a model that doesn’t work ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

item.title: Bringing High-Quality Image Models to Mobile: Hugging Face TIMM Meets Android & iOS
item.description: info This blog post is still a work in progress. If you require further clarifications before the contents are finalized, please get in touch with me here, on LinkedIn, or Twitter. üåü Motivation Meet Bob, a data scientist with a passion for computer vision. Bob had been working on a project to build a model that could identify different types of fruits, from apples to pineapples. He spent countless hours training and fine-tuning the model until it could recognize fruits with 98% accuracy.
